{"id":1245234033,"question_id":3249,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1714422619,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"608 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1245234033/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Number of Operations to Make Array XOR Equal to K","memory":"30.9 MB","code":"# from functools import reduce\n\nclass Solution:\n    def reduce(self, function, iterable, initializer=None):\n        it = iter(iterable)\n        if initializer is None:\n            value = next(it)\n        else:\n            value = initializer\n        for element in it:\n            value = function(value, element)\n        return value\n    def minOperations(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:\n        count = 0\n        for letter in bin(self.reduce(lambda x, y: x^y, nums)^k):\n            if letter == '1': count += 1\n\n        return count\n        return len([ letter for letter in bin(reduce(lambda x, y: x^y, nums)^k) if letter == '1' ])\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-number-of-operations-to-make-array-xor-equal-to-k","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
